data.title: Songs in English that contain some French lyrics
data.meta_description:
And up until today, I'd always thought he was saying Chevrolet, which is French?  Oh well, at least my kids are bilingual.
Wow, I've thought about that...
data.text:
Hi ya'll. My 1st time here / just signed-up / my 1st post.

I have been writing lists like these for years. (Songs that have the flute featured (featured, not just there once),

Songs about Native North American Indians, Movies that have waffles in them, Song/movies w/sexiest Legs, etc....!

I am a lyricist & have studied German and Russian language, but French I only learned the most basic (for when I drive up to Montreal).

But I am also a music nut, and have friends that study French - so I started working on my list- then I bumped into this page / forum

here. Of course most everything on my list has been covered (isn't nice that I shan't repeat what was already written!),

here are a few (22) left over:

"Blue Angel" (part of "Lavender") by Marillion. It is just one lyric of, " 'J'entend ton coeur, J'entend ton coeur, I can hear your heart..."

(short but a beautiful song - make sure to hear "Lavender" (the 1st part of it) first. ("Lavender" is also connected to their hit song, "Kayleigh").

"Montreal" by Marillion. Marillion, from England, are so welcomed in Montreal (they have their "Marillion weekend"s there every 2 years) that

they wrote a song for Montreal as a bit of a thank you. (A 14 minute thank you). This also does not have a lot of French in it, but thanks

various French things as well as the one or two lyrics.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lOGgbaiDvbU

" France was singing in the air of High-Rise North America /

I'll go shopping for shoes or whatever ensues, Je T'aime my darling Je T'aime my darling, See you soon /

in the Café of the Cirque 'Soleil, We bought easter eggs from outer space, 40 different languages are spoken in this place /

The Fleur de Lis was always kind to me, I'll make the time if ever you should call / Je T'aime my darling... "

"Beautiful" (or is it "Cannibal surf babe") by Marillion. The spoken French part by a young Woman is heard either at the end of

"Cannibal Surf Babe" (a slightly beach boys sounding rocker) or at the beginning of the single, "Beautiful" (a Love song about seeing beauty

instead of looking for fault). You can find both on youtube - and I have seen singles released with both. (end of 1 song or beginning of another?).

What is spoken in French is also spoken in English in "Cannibal Surf Babe".

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NYBmaWSbTJA

English: "And the sun came up over the mountain

And the waves rolled in across the bay

And the fabulous brightly colored birds

Flew up out of the forest

And she said, "Well, we're all heaven's

Beautiful children living together in paradise

Lie down my dear, you're going to enjoy this"

Francais: (copy/pasted from 'freeTranslation.com' as lyrics were not available)

"Et le soleil s'est levé sur la montagne

et les vagues laminés en traversant la baie

et le fabuleux oiseaux colorés

a volé jusqu'hors de la forêt,

et elle a dit, "Bien, nous sommes tous Heaven's

beaux enfants vivant ensemble dans le paradis

s'allonger mon cher, vous allez profiter de cette "

"Force Ten" by Rush

Just one lyric in this one:

"We can wear the rose of romance

An air of joie de vivre" (Joy of life / memory of happiness).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TBKCg25RBpQ

"Ne t'enfuis pas" by Kate Bush (don't fly away)

99% of the song is in French

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sreFD4yGVIs

"Un baiser d'enfant" by Kate Bush (The Infant Kiss)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VWSevsMRmJI

Genius in France! by 'Weird Al' Yankovic

This is one of Al's longest songs. It is a homage to the Frank Zappa Band & has the flavour of "why do the French LOVE Jerry Lewis?"

:) The French lyrics are thrown-in at simple points so the English speaking (American especially) audience will not become too confused.

You have to listen to this fun song in its entirety - but some of the French lyrics are:

"But when the Mademoiselles see me, they all swoon and shriek

They dig my mystique, they think I'm c'est magnifique

When I'm in Paris ('Paree'), I'm the chicest of the chic---

And when I'm sipping on a Perrier

In some cafe town in St. Tropez

It's hard to keep the fans at bay

They say, "Sign my poodle, s'il vous plait"

"Sign my poodle, s'il vous plait"

But when I'm in Provence, I get free croissants

Yeah, I'm the guy every French lady wants

They say, "Bonjour, Monsieur

Would you take ze picture with me?"

I say, "Oui, oui"

That's right

I say, "Oui, oui"

Like a fine Renoir, I've got that je me c'est quoi

Like a fine Renoir, I've got that je me c'est

Quoi quoi quoi quoi quoi, oo we oo-

-Entre nous, it's very true....

Every Frenchie that I meet

Just can't wait to kiss my feet

Get in line, pucker up! Tout Suite!

Say, would you pass the Grey Poupon?

Merci beaucoup."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hQTNBWIdLeI

Celine Dion - Being a French Canadian from Quebec, and French is her 1st language, Celine has done many songs in French. One that sticks-out to me, because

most people that do not speak a word of French still like it, is, "

"Les cloches du hameau". (The bells of the village). I think her many sisters & brothers and other family sing with her on this. It is mostly in French with different version giving more English. http://lyrics.wikia.com/wiki/Céline_Dion:Les_Cloches_Du_Hameau

http://www.amazon.com/French-Album-Celine-Dion/dp/B000002B45

(Samples from her French album are on this page)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hez7Vv6BSuU

Erasure - "Oh L'Amour"

Just this one lyric, though a very popular song-

"Oh l'amour broke my heart

Now I'm aching for you, mon amour..."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yjdt6pSVMKg

Feist - "L'amour ne dure pas toujours" AND "Tout Doucement"

Leslie Feist is a Canadian that has done a few songs in French. "1,2,3,4..." is her most popular as it was in a tv commercial - "apple" i think - that one is in English but there is also one with French in it... somewhere.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4fGszse311s

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F7h4xATpv6A

Mika - "Grace Kelly" As French as his 2nd of 4 languages, Mika took his most popular song and did a French version with it. He also has a version where it is half English and half French and other versions where either language lingers a little longer. He has other songs with French as well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xuow-2cyew

Pink Martini - "Je Ne Veux Pas Travailler"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lle_GA1cg20

Enigma – “Sadeness part 1”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4F9DxYhqmKw

“Mademoiselle” by STYX

“Je t'aime Mademoiselle, ooh la la” is the only French lyric.

Sarah Brightman The lovely Sarah Brightman has done many songs in French (also songs in Italian, Spanish, German, Japanese, Latin, English, Arabic, Turkish, Russian, ..... - Some of the French ones, or ones including French are:

Fleurs du mal (Flowers of saddness) This symphonic/Hard Rock song is mostly in English with the chorus and a few bits en Francais:

https://vimeo.com/57302198

"We run 'til it's gone

Et les fleurs du mal...

Les fleurs du mal unfold

Comme les fleurs du mal

Dark demons of my soul

Un amour fatal

Been tryin' hard to fight

Comme les fleurs du mal

Les fleurs du mal inside

Un amour fatal

We live and we pray

Pour les fleurs du mal..."

Others are:

Tout ce que je sais (everything that I know)

Gueri de toi ('something' of thee)

La Lune (of the Moon)

La Luna (the Moon)

Il mio cuore va (My heart will go on)

Un jour il viendra (one day he'll come)
